sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Germany becomes the latest European country to beef up its border security in a bid to curb illegal entries along the Balkan route.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Italy sets up its first centre for migrants from so-called safe countries in a bid to accelerate the process of asylum claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Defying expectations. A new forecast predicts Russia's economy to grow this year in spite of Western sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The foundations of the Schengen Treaty crumbling at the heart of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Germany has become the latest country to beef up its border controls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Berlin says it has increased security along the borders with Poland and the Czech Republic B4Pits Border Controls. Berlin sagt, es hat die Sicherheit auf den Bordern mit Polen und der Tschechischen Republik erhöht, um eine scharfe Aufnahme in illegalen Entrennen und Asylbewerber-Applikationen zu haben. They are putting human lives at the stake with maximum profit. That's why the federal police are immediately taking additional flexible control of the railways at the border with Poland and the Czech Republic." The announcement came a day after police raids in Germany found more than 100 Syrian citizens inside apartments searched in connection with a smuggling ring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday, Poland also tightened its borders with Slovakia, and on Wednesday Slovenia followed suit along its southern border with Croatia. Germany's Interior Ministry says about a quarter of all migrants who reached Germany are smuggled in across the Mediterranean Sea and the Balkans route.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Italy has set up its first centre for asylum seekers deemed to have come from so-called safe countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Italian government hopes the facility in the Sicilian port of Pizzallo will accelerate the process of asylum claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It will house people who can't claim refugee status as they've arrived from countries not considered to be dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It comes as Italy struggles to cope with severe overcrowding at its migrant centre on Lampedusa Island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Authorities have begun moving some to other locations after a recent surge in arrivals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The extent of the problem was highlighted earlier this month when some migrants broke out of the centre because of a lack of space and essential provisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In an effort to reduce numbers arriving, Prime Minister Giorgio Maloney's cabinet is implementing measures against young adults posing as unaccompanied minors in order to claim state protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Despite the impact of Western sanctions, Russia's economy is now forecast to grow this year instead of shrink, as was previously predicted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: That's the view of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development in a statement to the AFP news agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In May, the bank saw Russia's GDP shrinking by 1.5%. It now says it will actually grow by the same figure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The EBRD, which was founded to help ex-Soviet countries adapt to free markets, says Russia's revenues have been boosted by high oil prices and new export opportunities with China, India and Central Asia. It had expected an oil price cap as part of sanctions to have a greater negative impact Russia has sought to strengthen trade links with China India and other non-aligned nations to shore up its sanctions hit economy nevertheless the institution believes this won't be enough to offset a cooling of the Russian economy in 2024. foreign The general leading Ukraine's counter-offensive along the southern front line,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Oleksandr Tarnavsky, promised, quote, good news from the front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But what is happening there? The Institute for the Study of War says the tactical situation in Vrbovo remains unclear as Ukrainian forces continue defensive operations in western Zaporizhia region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has lost his appeal against a 19-year sentence added to his existing jail term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It was imposed in August after he was convicted on six charges related to alleged extremist activity, which he denies. The 19-year sentence is on top of 11 and a half years that he's already serving for fraud and other charges. Navalny is one of the most visible opponents of the Russian regime, which has incarcerated him since his return in 2021 after nearly dying in a poisoning attempt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Internet giant Amazon's being sued by the Federal Trade Commission and 17 states over

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: allegations it inflates online prices and overcharges sellers. The lawsuit's the result of a year-long investigation into the company's businesses and one of the most significant legal challenges brought against it in its nearly 30-year history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Seattle-based Amazon said the FTC is wrong on the facts and the law and had departed from its role of protecting consumers and competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: British regulators have approved new oil and gas drilling at a site in the North Sea,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: a move environmentalists say will hurt the country's bid to meet its climate goals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Authorities angered climate activists by giving permission to the Rosebank field development plan, claiming drilling will create jobs and bolster the UK's energy security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: One of the largest untapped deposits in UK waters, Rosebank holds an estimated 350 million barrels of oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Critics say it's the latest climate U-turn by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Conservative government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Four girls and two boys aged between 11 and 24 from Portugal, have their first day of hearings at the European Court of Human Rights in Strasbourg on Wednesday as part of a case against 32 European states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Agostinho and others case accuses these governments of failing to tackle the climate crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The motivation stems from the 2017 wildfires in Portugal, which claimed more than 100 lives with the case filed in September 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They say they're already feeling the effects in their daily lives and also fear for their futures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As I said, the fires are very close to the area where I live.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Fires that have already put my life at risk, the lives of my sisters. Fogos que já me puseram a minha vida em risco, a vida das minhas irmãs. Dias de escola que foram perdidos por causa de excesso de fumo no ar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: As minhas lanças respiratórias não têm vindo a melhorar propriamente. their future is at stake. So they experience the climate harms for a much greater period of time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Therefore we're arguing they're discriminated against.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And the court also asked us to deal with questions of inhumane treatment and degrading treatment by virtue of the mental anguish and traumatization that the climate crisis will create for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Their legal team expects a victory that would be equivalent to what it describes as a legally binding regional treaty compelling all 32 countries to rapidly accelerate their climate action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's a view shared by the Council of Europe's commissioner for human rights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I think the time is right that we move from words to deeds, as we know there are numerous resolutions, numerous conventions wonderful wonderful words on paper but the action is missing. The legal argument of the governments in question says that the case has no supporting evidence to claim that the plaintiffs are in more danger than the rest the Portuguese population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They say that they're already undertaking their mitigation a população portuguesa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Dizem que já estão fazendo seus compromissos de mitigação no Acordo de Clima de Paris de 2015. representa os 32 governos. Os países em causa são os 27 da União Europeia e ainda Noruega, Suíça, Reino Unido, Turquia e Rússia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Um porta-voz dessa equipa disse à Euronews que não queriam fazer comentários nesta fase do processo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Isabel Marques da Silva, em Estrasburgo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Escootas elétricas estão em todos os lugares na Praga. Há milhares de elas. Electric scooters are everywhere in Prague. There are thousands of them. Nobody knows the exact number.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Their boom started right after the Covid pandemic when tourists from all over the world returned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And while they're designed as an easy, eco-friendly mode of transport, in the wrong hands they can be a menace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: City police officers have dealt with 13,000 scooter-related offences by August, twice as many as in the whole of 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Over 4,000 people were fined and accidents and injuries are on the rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Managers of Prague's historic quarter wants to ban scooters as they did Segway seven years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But talks with the mayor and police are still taking place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Scooters can be left on the sidewalk right in front of the city hall without any problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Modern technology has again outstripped legislation and negotiations are ongoing between the municipality and the Ministry of Transport on how best to regulate the situation before next season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The council is still looking for a solution that would prevent the uncontrolled parking of wheelchairs on the roads and mainly on the sidewalks of the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Jiri Skancel, Euronews, Prague.
